title: Add richer animations, Niraj-only site logo upload, and Admin Orders dashboard

requirements.text: Increase modern animations and micro-interactions across the website (Home, Catalog, Product Details, Cart, Checkout, About, Admin) by adding more visible motion such as section entrance animations, hover/tap feedback on cards/buttons, and subtle transitions for navigation and page content changes, while keeping performance smooth and consistent with the existing non-blue/purple theme.

quotes: CAN YOU MAKE MORE ANIMATION IN WEBSITE .

acceptanceCriteria: Key sections on major pages have noticeable entrance animations (e.g., fade/slide) that do not feel jittery.
Buttons/cards/navigation elements have consistent hover/focus/active micro-interactions (scale/translate/shadow) using existing Tailwind/utility patterns.
Animations do not block core interactions (e.g., add to cart, checkout) and remain usable on mobile.

requirements.text: Add backend support to store and serve a site logo image and allow only the admin (Niraj) to upload/replace it: implement a public query method to fetch the current logo and an admin-only update method to set/replace the logo using the existing Storage.ExternalBlob types and the existing admin authorization checks used for CEO photo/product CRUD.

quotes: AND ONE MORE THING AT LEFT TOP CORRER THERE IS WRITEN F S ENTERPRISES NO LOGO SO I WANT TO UPLOAD LOGO GIVE THIS ACCESS TO ONLY NIRAJ

acceptanceCriteria: Backend exposes a query to retrieve the current logo (returns null/none when not set).
Backend exposes an admin-only method to update the logo; non-admin callers are rejected with a clear English error message.
Logo storage uses the same ExternalBlob mechanism already used for CEO photo, without introducing additional backend services.

requirements.text: Update the site header branding (top-left) to display the site logo when available (fetched from the backend); when no logo is set, fall back to the current header branding (icon + “FS Enterprises” text). Add a Niraj-admin-only UI to upload/replace the site logo (including preview and save) and persist it to the backend, using the existing admin gating approach used elsewhere in the app.

quotes: AT LEFT TOP CORRER THERE IS WRITEN F S ENTERPRISES NO LOGO SO I WANT TO UPLOAD LOGO GIVE THIS ACCESS TO ONLY NIRAJ

acceptanceCriteria: Header shows the uploaded logo image when set; otherwise it shows the existing default branding.
Only admins (Niraj) can see and use the logo upload/replace UI; non-admin users never see upload controls.
Logo upload flow provides a preview and a success/error state; on success, the header updates to the new logo without a full reload.

requirements.text: Add an Admin dashboard option/page labeled “Orders” that is visible only to the admin (Niraj). The Orders view must list orders and clearly show who placed each order (at minimum the user principal; show the user’s saved profile name when available). Use the existing backend getAllOrders admin-only method and existing user profile retrieval to display user details.

quotes: MAKE ONE OPTION AT DASHBOARD 'ORDERS ' WHERE ADMIN CAN SEE WHAT ARE ORDERS AND WHO HAS GIVE THAT .

acceptanceCriteria: Admin navigation includes an “Orders” option within the Admin area (only visible when the caller is admin).
Orders page lists all orders returned by the backend (not just the current user’s orders).
Each order row/card shows: order id, total, items summary, and who placed it (principal; and profile name when available).
Non-admin users cannot access the Orders page and are shown the existing access denied behavior.

constraints: Backend must remain a single-actor Motoko canister (all logic in backend/main.mo).
Do not edit files under frontend immutablePaths (must compose existing UI components rather than modifying read-only sources).
Do not serve images through the backend as static files; use the existing ExternalBlob pattern for uploaded images (logo/CEO photo).
All user-facing text added/updated must be in English.
nonGoals: Adding third-party authentication providers or external storage/CDN for images.
Changing the checkout/order placement logic beyond what is needed to support admin order viewing UI.
